text: ® Clients send requests to servers (i.e., invocation) ® Servers send responses to clients (i.e., result) ® Servers may be clients of other servers - A web server is often a client of a file server — An Internet service is a client of a DNS server - a server that translates DNS names to IP addresses ® Potential problem: a single server is a scalability bottleneck and a single point of failure
